content.question: Which of the following broader historical contexts best explains Tubman’s fear of “being carried away”?

choices.label: Enslaved African Americans were being sent to Africa by the American Colonization Society to build overseas colonies.
Enslaved African Americans believed that resisting slavery would lead to a delay in gaining freedom through the Underground Railroad.
Enslaved African Americans were taken from plantations to fight for the Union army during the Civil War.
Enslaved African Americans were often forcibly sold by plantation owners as a part of the domestic slave trade.

content.answer: Enslaved African Americans were often forcibly sold by plantation owners as a part of the domestic slave trade.
